idle.$description: Use for links in their default or hovered state.

hover.$description: Use for links in hover state.

idle.$description: Use for muted links in idle state.

hover.$description: Use for muted links in hover state.

active.$description: Use for muted links in active state.
Use for links in active state.

idle.$description: Used for the linkcolor of navigation aids in idle state, such as skip links, when they are focused or visible.

hover.$description: Used for the linkcolor of navigation aids in hovered state, such as skip links, when they are focused or visible.

active.$description: Used for the linkcolor of navigation aids in pressed state, such as skip links, when they are focused or visible.

idle.$description: Use for inverted links in idle state.

hover.$description: Use for inverted links in hover state.

active.$description: Use for inverted links in active state.

bold.$description: A neutral border option that passes min 3:1 contrast ratios.
Use for borders that highlight informative actions or messages on muted, subtlest and subtle background colors.

plain.$description: Use for borders that highlight informative actions or messages on elevation.surface background colors.

subtle.$description: Use for subtle borders on color.background.info background colors.

input.$description: Use for borders of form UI elements, such as text fields, checkboxes and, radio buttons.

plain.$description: Use to visually group or seperate UI elements, such as card, tabs or side panel dividers.

bold.$description: Use for bold red borders for purely stylistic purposes with no specific meaning.

plain.$description: Use for plain red borders for purely stylistic purposes with no specific meaning.

plain.$description: Use for plain blue borders for purely stylistic purposes with no specific meaning.

focused.$description: Use for focus rings of elements in a focus state.

disabled.$description: Use for borders of elements in a disabled state.

inverted.$description: Use for borders on bold backgrounds.

bold.$description: Use for borders that highlight negative or serious error states on muted, subtlest and subtle background colors.

plain.$description: Use for borders that highlight negative or serious error states on elevation.surface background colors.

bold.$description: Use for borders that highlight a favorable outcome on muted, subtlest and subtle background colors.

selected.$description: Use for borders that emphasize selected states, such as tabs or menu items.

bold.$description: Use for borders that highlight secondary actions or messages on muted, subtlest and subtle background colors.

Use for screen overlay that appears with dialogs or drawers.
Use for skeleton loading states.

subtle.$description: Use for the pulse or shimmer effect in skeleton loading states.

bold.$description: Use for backgrounds of elements in a neutral state that require a bold emphasis or a minimum color contrast of 3:1, such as switch backgrounds.
Use for the background of actions with bold emphasis related to informative messages.

subtle.$description: A subtle background for informative messages.

subtlest.$description: The subtlest background for informative messages.

bold.$description: Used as transparent layer on top of the bold background to indicate the hover and pressed state.

plain.$description: Used as transparent layer on top of the muted, subtlest and subtle background to indicate the hover and pressed state.
Use for backgrounds of form UI elements, such as text fields, checkboxes, and radio buttons.

interactive.$description: Used as transparent layer on top of the input background to indicate the hover state.

Use for text that communicates informative messages the user needs to be aware of on info backgrounds, such as 'color.background.info.muted' and 'color.background.info.subtle'.

plain.$description: Use for text that communicates informative messages the user needs to be aware of on neutral backgrounds.

onBold.$description: Use for text that communicates informative messages the user needs to be aware of on info backgrounds, such as 'color.background.info.bold'.

plain.$description: Use for body copy and menu items.

bold.$description: Use for red text on 'color.background.accent.red.muted' or 'color.background.accent.red.subtle', when used purely for stylistic purposes without specific meaning.

plain.$description: Use for red text on neutral backgrounds for purely stylistic purposes with no specific meaning.

onBold.$description: Use for text on 'color.background.accent.red.bold', when used purely for stylistic purposes without specific meaning.

bold.$description: Use for blue text on 'color.background.accent.blue.muted' or 'color.background.accent.blue.subtle', when used purely for stylistic purposes without specific meaning.

plain.$description: Use for blue text on neutral backgrounds for purely stylistic purposes with no specific meaning.

onBold.$description: Use for text on 'color.background.accent.blue.bold', when used purely for stylistic purposes without specific meaning.

bold.$description: Use for bold grey text for purely stylistic purposes with no specific meaning.

faint.$description: Use for faint text on neutral backgrounds, providing low contrast. Not intended for primary content, as it does not meet WCAG 2.2 AA contrast requirements. Use sparingly where accessibility isn't a critical concern.

plain.$description: Use for plain grey text for purely stylistic purposes with no specific meaning.

onBold.$description: Use for text on 'color.background.accent.grey.bold', when used purely for stylistic purposes without specific meaning.

subtle.$description: Use for subtle grey text for purely stylistic purposes with no specific meaning.

subtlest.$description: Use for subtle grey text for purely stylistic purposes with no specific meaning.

onInverted.$description: Use for text on 'color.background.inverted', when used purely for stylistic purposes without specific meaning.

bold.$description: Use for teal text on 'color.background.accent.teal.muted' or 'color.background.accent.teal.subtle', when used purely for stylistic purposes without specific meaning.

plain.$description: Use for teal text on neutral backgrounds for purely stylistic purposes with no specific meaning.

onBold.$description: Use for text on 'color.background.accent.blue.bold', when used purely for stylistic purposes without specific meaning.

bold.$description: Use for green text on 'color.background.accent.green.muted' or 'color.background.accent.green.subtle', when used purely for stylistic purposes without specific meaning.

plain.$description: Use for green text on neutral backgrounds for purely stylistic purposes with no specific meaning.

onBold.$description: Use for text on 'color.background.accent.green.bold', when used purely for stylistic purposes without specific meaning.

bold.$description: Use for orange text on 'color.background.accent.orange.muted' or 'color.background.accent.orange.subtle', when used purely for stylistic purposes without specific meaning.

plain.$description: Use for orange text on neutral backgrounds for purely stylistic purposes with no specific meaning.

onBold.$description: Use for text on 'color.background.accent.orange.bold', when used purely for stylistic purposes without specific meaning.

bold.$description: Use for purple text on 'color.background.accent.purple.muted' or 'color.background.accent.purple.subtle', when used purely for stylistic purposes without specific meaning.

onBold.$description: Use for text on 'color.background.accent.purple.bold', when used purely for stylistic purposes without specific meaning.

bold.$description: Use for yellow text on 'color.background.accent.yellow.muted' or 'color.background.accent.yellow.subtle', when used purely for stylistic purposes without specific meaning.

plain.$description: Use for yellow text on neutral backgrounds for purely stylistic purposes with no specific meaning.

onBold.$description: Use for text on 'color.background.accent.yellow.bold', when used purely for stylistic purposes without specific meaning.

subtle.$description: Use for labels and subheadings.

bold.$description: Use for text that communicates caution to prevent mistakes or errors on caution backgrounds, such as 'color.background.caution.muted', and 'color.background.caution.subtle'.

plain.$description: Use for text that communicates caution to prevent mistakes or errors on neutral backgrounds.

onBold.$description: Use for text that communicates caution to prevent mistakes or errors on 'color.background.caution.bold'.

bold.$description: Use for neutral actions on 'color.background.neutral.muted' and 'color.background.secondary.subtle'.

plain.$description: Use for neutral actions on 'color.background.neutral.muted' and 'color.background.secondary.subtle'.

bold.$description: Use for primary actions on 'color.background.primary.muted' and 'color.background.primary.subtle'.

disabled.$description: Use for text in a disabled state.

bold.$description: Use for inverted text on 'color.background.inverted.subtlest', and 'color.background.inverted.subtle'.

plain.$description: Use for plain inverted text.

bold.$description: Use for text that communicates negative or serious error states (e.g., validation errors or irreversible actions) on 'color.background.negative.muted', and 'color.background.negative.subtle'.

plain.$description: Use for text that communicates negative or serious error states (e.g., validation errors or irreversible actions) on neutral backgrounds.

onBold.$description: Use for text that communicates negative or serious error states (e.g., validation errors or irreversible actions) on 'color.background.negative.bold'.

bold.$description: Use for text that communicates a favorable outcome on positive backgrounds, such as 'color.background.positive.muted', and 'color.background.positive.subtle'.

plain.$description: Use for text that communicates a favorable outcome on neutral backgrounds.'

onBold.$description: Use for text that communicates a favorable outcome on positive backgrounds, such as 'color.background.positive.bold'.

bold.$description: Use for text in selected states (e.g., tabs or menu items).

plain.$description: Used as selected foreground color on white backgrounds.

onBold.$description: Use for text in selected states (e.g., tabs or menu items).

bold.$description: Use for secondary actions on 'color.background.secondary.muted' and 'color.background.secondary.subtle'.

default.$description: The default, flat surface level. Used for primary content backgrounds or non-interactive UI regions.

sunken.$description: Background for components that create a sunken effect, typically used for grouping related items.

default.$description: Background of elevated components like cards, grids, or dropdowns that sit on top of the base surface. Use in combination with 'elevation.shadow.raised'.

inverted.$description: Background of elevated components with an inverted background color like tooltips that sit on top of the base surface. Use in combination with 'elevation.shadow.raised'.

alternative.$description: An alternate surface color used for visual differentiation in components like tables or lists, providing contrast between consecutive items (e.g., zebra striping).
